name: Lazo
description:
After a pleasant family afternoon, a being from the forest loses his kid in the enchanted forest, which is not what it seems. He will have to face various obstacles and his own fear that play against him in his attempt to find his kid as soon as possible, before something can happen to him or worse... that the bond that unites them is broken.

Lazo is a 3D third-person puzzle-adventure game developed in UE4. It was created as a final project for the Unreal Engine Training Center course taught by Arden Civil Association of Guadalajara.

The team consisted of 7 members:

  • Antonio Cham: Programmer
  • Fidel Araguz Lara: Programmer
  • Pablo Murillo: Programmer
  • Sayana Michel Carrazco Aguirre: 2D & 3D artist
  • José Luis Rodríguez Medrano: 3D artist 
  • Tanya Hdez. Bricker: Technical Game Designer
  • Hugo Rodriguez: Game Designer

This build represents only a prototype of the gameplay as a first approach to the main mechanics. The concept and design of the experience such as narrative, characters, level design, etc. they exist only in writing, they have not yet been developed.
